results.title: The Fallen idol
results.creator_credit: Carol Reed, David O. Selznick and London Film Productions
results.brief_description: An ambassador’s small son nearly incriminates his friend the butler in the accidental death of his shrewish wife. A near-perfect piece of small-scale cinema, built up from clever nuances of acting and cinematic technique. Written by Graham Greene. Stars Ralph Richardson. Rated: PG
results.creator_credit_for_label: Carol Reed, David O. Selznick and London Film Productions

results.title: Seeing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Seeing involves both the eyes and the brain. The development of seeing and the beginning of visual awareness are discussed. An eye specialist explains how the eye works and stresses the importance of the early detection of eye problems. Eye tests are demonstrated and the problems associated with glasses discussed. We examine common childhood ailments and injuries, parents talk about their visually impaired children and some advice is offered by an early childhood specialist.

results.title: Fighting Arthritis: The Importance of Self Management
results.brief_description: Fighting Arthritis speaks to both the health professional and the lay person. Through the words of people with arthritis, spouses, doctors and health promotion personnel, a dynamic picture emerges of how we can all benefit from the self management approach to arthritis.

results.title: Betty Cuthbert
results.creator_credit: Kathy Mueller, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders, Coote and Carroll and Roadshow Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
This moving drama series on important figures from Australia’s past brings history to life. Betty Cuthbert, the “Golden Girl”, held a very special place in the affections of the sporting world because of her immense courage, optimism and innate modesty. Betty competed in 3 Olympic Games during her 13 year career as the world’s greatest female runner.

results.title: Lottie Lyell
results.creator_credit: Ben Lewin, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
This moving drama series on important figures from Australia’s past brings Australian history to life. Lottie Lyell was one of Australia’s most successful actresses. Although she often played the damsel in distress in her early films, Lottie was no helpless heroine in real life. As well as starring in her films, she worked behind the cameras as script writer, art director, costume designer, editor and business manager. She was part of an excellent team with Raymond Longford, Australia’s best known silent film director with whom she had a long and enduring relationship.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ben Lewin, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders and Film Australia

results.title: Boomalli: five Koorie artists
results.creator_credit: Michael Riley, Paul Humfress and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Boomalli is an artists’ co-operative - a collection of photographers, painters, sculptors, designers and filmmakers, who are urban Aboriginal or Koorie artists. The work presented ranges from that of fashion designer Bronwyn Bancroft, the sand sculpture of Fiona Foley, Tracey Moffatt’s film, “Nice coloured girls” and the paintings of Raymond Meeks and Jeffrey Samuals. This visually rich and inspiring film is about their work. Their achievements speak for themselves.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Riley, Paul Humfress and Film Australia

results.title: Antarctic Pioneers
results.creator_credit: Frank Hurley, Phillip Garth Law, Frank Bagnall, Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: One of Australia’s most famous photographers and explorers, Frank Hurley, presents this absorbing film on the history of Australia’s first expeditions to the Antarctic continent between 1911 and 1954. It includes remarkable, original footage of the expedition on the tall ship Aurora in 1911, the Campbell expedition in 1947 and the Law expedition in 1954. Much of this film was made by Hurley when he accompanied Sir Douglas Mawson and an Australian party to the Antarctic in 1912 and on later expeditions. The program traces the history of the Australian expeditions between 1911 and 1914 and the establishment of Mawson Station. A rare film which reveals the true hardship and courage of these early pioneers.

results.title: Spinning with Dianna
results.brief_description: Dianna takes the beginners through each process from combing, spinning, plying, winding and washing of the yarn ready for use in varied garments.
results.description: Dianna takes the beginners through each process from combing, spinning, plying, winding and washing of the yarn ready for use in varied garments.

results.title: Peter Grimes
results.creator_credit: John Tooley, John Vernon, Elijah Moshinsky, BBC-TV and Covent Garden Video Productions
results.brief_description: Peter Grimes, the opera by Benjamin Britten, libretto by Montagu, directed by Sir John Tooley is based on George Crabbe’s long narrative poem, “The Borough”, and is set on the East Coast of England in a small fishing community dominated by the sea. The theme is universal - conflict between an individual and a society that sees him as an outsider. Features performers Jon Vickers (Peter Grimes), Heather Harper (Ellen Oxford), Norman Bailey (Captain Balstrode), The Royal Opera Chorus and the Orchestra of the Royal Opera House conducted by Sir Colin Davis. Recorded at The Royal Opera House, Covent Garden.

results.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
results.brief_description: James Stewart stars as naive young Jefferson Smith, the well-loved head of a chain of boys’ clubs, who is unwittingly set up by a group of unscrupulous politicians and sent to Washington as a Senator. He is expected to vote as the party machine dictates and so ease the passage of a fraudulent Bill. Jeff discovers the double-deal and the normally mild mannered good guy turns into a veritable “house on fire” to attack the web of corruption that surrounds him.
